Dwellers of brackish coastal salt marshes and fetid bogs and swamps, marsh giants appear hideous to most airbreathers, with fishlike mouths, slimy gray-green skin, and dark, beady eyes. They prefer to eat the flesh of those they slay in battle, including other marsh giants, and guzzle stagnant water from cauldrons or directly from their swampy homes.
Marsh giant clans are insular, with each clan dedicating itself to zealous worship of a sea-dwelling deity, demon lord, or stranger entity. Whatever forces call to the marsh giants sometimes ensnare boggards and ogres as well, gathering in grim worship. Rather than favor these humanoid hangers-on, marsh giants lavish attention on favored pets: [krooths](/Monsters.aspx?ID=276), [giant octopuses](/Monsters.aspx?ID=315), or primeval creatures like [dinosaurs](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=391) and the crocodilian [deinosuchuses](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2888). Barely topping 11 feet tall and 1,000 pounds, marsh giants are small for giants but make up for their stature with their zealotry. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 24 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 19 [Marsh Giant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3011) **Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 164 1.1 **Perception** +16; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Jotun](/Languages.aspx?ID=8), [Thalassic](/Languages.aspx?ID=113) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +18, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +15, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +15, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +17 **Str** +6 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +1 **Items** _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [gaff](/Weapons.aspx?ID=169)_ --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +18 **Ref** +13 **Will** +17 **HP** 150 --- **Speed** 35 feet, swim 20 feet **Melee** _gaff_ +20 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 2d6+14 bludgeoning **Melee** fist +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d6+14 bludgeoning **Ranged** spit +20 ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [range 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [Water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)), **Damage** 5d6 bludgeoning **Occult Innate Spells** DC 23 - **2nd** [Augury](/Spells.aspx?ID=15), [Mist](/Spells.aspx?ID=1606) - **5th** [Mariner's Curse](/Spells.aspx?ID=184) **Drowning Hook** ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)) **Requirements** A creature is [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88) within the marsh giant's reach; **Effect** The marsh giant uses its gaff to push the creature down as water bubbles up below it. The target becomes submerged in water until they are no longer prone and must [hold their breath](/Rules.aspx?ID=468) if they cannot breathe water. They take 4d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 23 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save) and lose 3 rounds worth of air if they fail the save. **Twist the Hook** The marsh giant makes a melee Strike with its gaff. If it hits, it twists and yanks the gaff to knock the target [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=88) and create an awful wound, dealing 2d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) to the creature.
Gaffs Many marsh giants fight with an oversized gaff—a length of wood with a metal hook affixed to the tip. The giants use them to drown prey as humanoid fishers use them to land fish. A gaff is a common martial weapon in the club group. It deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage and has 1 Bulk. It requires one hand to use and has the trip and versatile P weapon traits. Gaffs are readily available anywhere fishers live, costing 1 gp.
